missing_connections.label: Missing Connections
missing_connections.explanation: This metric identifies connections in the student's solution that are present in the reference solution but missing in the student's solution.
missing_connections: Natural Language Processing enables Sentiment Analysis

Natural Language Processing enables Speech Recognition

mislabeled_connections.label: Mislabeled Connections
mislabeled_connections.explanation: This metric identifies connections in the student's solution where the labeling does not match the reference solution.

extra_connections.label: Extra Connections
extra_connections.explanation: This metric shows connections in the student's solution that are not present in the reference solution.

missing_concepts.label: Missing Concepts
missing_concepts.explanation: This metric identifies concepts that are present in the reference solution but missing in the student's solution.

extra_concepts.label: Extra Concepts
extra_concepts.explanation: This metric shows concepts in the student's solution that are not part of the reference solution.

unused_labels.label: Unused Labels
unused_labels.explanation: This metric shows labels that are present in the reference solution but not used in the student's solution.

isolated_concepts.label: Isolated Concepts
isolated_concepts.explanation: This metric identifies concepts in the student's solution that have no connections to other concepts, compared to the reference solution.

topologic_similarity.label: Topological Similarity
topologic_similarity.explanation: This metric compares the structure of the entire networks using the Jaccard coefficient.

centrality_similarity.label: Centrality Similarity
centrality_similarity.explanation: This metric calculates the centrality (importance) of concepts in both maps and compares them.

connection_density.label: Connection Density
connection_density.explanation: The connection density of a network measures how strongly the nodes (in this case, the student's concepts) are connected to each other. It indicates how many actual connections exist compared to the maximum possible connections. A higher density means the concepts are more interconnected.

graph_cycles.label: Graph Cycles
graph_cycles.explanation: A cycle in a graph occurs when a sequence of edges and nodes forms a closed path, meaning the starting node of the sequence is also the end node. In a concept map, cycles should generally be avoided as they can complicate the hierarchical structure and understanding of the relationships between concepts. An acyclic structure promotes clear and orderly comprehension of the concepts.
